synopsis: In episode #7 of Pineapple Plant Rotation, hosts Devam and Ahir delve into the complexities of self-judgment and the pain it can cause. They explore the importance of accepting one's own feelings and experiences while navigating personal growth, relationships, and the challenges of life in their 20s, all with a refreshing blend of humor and insight.
quotes: You need to trust the people who are right for you to accept you as you are.
Life can only be lived forwards but can only be understood backwards.
Sometimes it feels good to lie down and just allow yourself to feel.
You can't control how people see you; you need to focus on your own enjoyment.
The pain that you cause others can come from the pain youâ€™re experiencing yourself.
Being mature doesn't mean ignoring your feelings; it means acknowledging them.
You can run from your pain, but that doesn't mean it will go away.
Accepting your limitations is key to understanding your true self.
I always wait too long to do every single thing.
I made a decision never to tell you how I was feeling.
